titlestmt.subtitle: Papers of John Finley Crowe, 1822-1823, at the Lilly Library, Indiana University
titlestmt.author: Ava Dickerson

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2024-02-18 22:32:38 -0500.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.abstract: The Crowe mss., ca. 1822-1823, consist of typed transcripts of sixteen lectures on political economy delivered by economist John Finley Crowe, 1787-1860.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.
Many collections are housed offsite; retrieval requires advance notice. Please make an appointment a minimum of one week in advance of your visit.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Photography and digitization may be restricted for some collections. Copyright restrictions may apply. Before publishing, researchers are responsible for securing permission from all applicable rights holders, then filling out the Permission to Publish form.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: John Finley Crowe, 1787-1860, was a Presbyterian minister and economist who later founded (and was president of) Hanover College in Hanover, Indiana.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of sixteen typed transcripts of political economy lectures delivered by Crowe. Topics include Adam Smith, David Ricardo and other 18th century economic theorists.

Domenico Gagliardo, a professor of labor economics at University of Kansas, acquired the essays and gave them to L. L. Waters in 1939 when he joined the faculty (see donor's provenance note in Vertical File).

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The lectures have been ordered and paginated as though preparing for publication.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Item], Crowe mss., Lilly Library, Indiana University, Bloomington, Indiana.
